intro: Pavetta zeylanica var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth pavetta, is a flowering plant native to southern India and Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. The fruit is a small, capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
